alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:56PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Monroe County through 1100 PM EDT... At 956 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dundee, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dundee around 1000 PM EDT. Ida around 1010 PM EDT. Maybee around 1015 PM EDT. Monroe around 1020 PM EDT. Carleton around 1025 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Newport, Azalia, Estral Beach, Scofield, South Rockwood, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, La Salle, Bolles Harbor and Detroit Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
